page.title: 05SUTTON ODEON, BIRMINGHAM
page.content: THE ODEON CINEMA OF SUTTON COLDFIELD WAS BUILT 50 YEARS AGO BY OSCAR DEUTCH IN 1936 NOT LONG BEFORE HIS DEATH IN THE EARLY 1940'S.BEFORE HE BUILT THIS HE WAS A SCRAP METAL MERCHANT.IN THE YEAR 1972 THIS CINEMA HAD THE PROUD HONOUR OF BECOMING THE FIRST TRIPLE CINEMA.THAT,IS THREE FILMS COULD BE SHOWN AT ONE TIME IN THREE DIFFERENT ROOMS.NOW THE ODEON SEATS A MAXIMUM OF 864 PEOPLE. CINEMA FINANCE RATES Â£18,000;EMPTYING GARBAGE Â£1,000;WAGES Â£15,000;ELECTRICITY Â£300;HEATING Â£600.PROFITS ARE NOT PUBLISHED.COLUMBIA PICTURES GET 50-60% OF BOX OFFICE COLLECTIONS.THERE ARE 25 PEOPLE EMPLOYED THERE NOW IN 1985.FAMILY FILMS ARE BEST LIKED HERE. SATURDAY EVENINGS ARE THE BUSIEST.THE COMMONIST AGE GROUP OF FILM GOERS ARE 16-25 YRS.
